sentences.english: I'm still a young girl, least I think I am.
sentences.chinese: 在你們面前，我想我仍舊是個不懂事的少女。

sentences.english: She also said that Lisa was such a good girl who was very well-disciplined and well-behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她還誇我女兒懂事，說她是個很好的小姑娘。

sentences.english: Sometimes I think the U. S. is a crybaby.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我覺得美國像個不懂事的嬰兒。

sentences.english: To tell the truth, first entered university, I do not really sensible.
sentences.chinese: 實話實說，剛進大學的時候，我還真不懂事。

sentences.english: It would be wise (advisable) to handle thellos delicate problem with calmness and patience.
sentences.chinese: 冷靜耐煩的處理這個微妙問題是懂事理的。

sentences.english: I will be on your board but don’t ask me for anything.
sentences.chinese: 我會出任你的懂事，但別向我要任何東西。

sentences.english: His grandfather is always carping  about the young.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父總是指摘青年人不懂事。

sentences.english: The dog helped the officers by stiffening his hind legs as they pulled him out.
sentences.chinese: 小狗也懂事的把後腿蹬直，幫助營救人員拉它出來。

sentences.english: This innocent process is how we get our first messages about sex.
sentences.chinese: 這個不懂事的歷程是我們如何獲得第一個性信息。

sentences.english: Before the inexperience I have now disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 以前的不懂事的我，現在已經不見了。

sentences.english: She is always running her children dowm in public.
sentences.chinese: 她總是當着人的面說自己的孩子不懂事。

sentences.english: Your view on the world is different, sensible, and no longer childish.
sentences.chinese: 你對世界的看法不同了，懂事了，不再幼稚了。

sentences.english: She is like a child, always not sensible to tease his patience.
sentences.chinese: 她像個孩子一樣，總是不懂事的挑逗他的耐性。

sentences.english: He was nothing but a ignorant child then.
sentences.chinese: 他那時只是個不懂事的小孩子。

sentences.english: Now grown up a sensible, so that parents will not copy the heart.
sentences.chinese: 現在長大了懂事了，不會讓父母抄心了。

sentences.english: Passers-by ignorance to blame the children, the elderly have called on foot.
sentences.chinese: 路人責備孩子不懂事，竟叫老人步行。

definition: filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
to do what one is told/obedient
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
variant of 賢慧|贤慧[xian2 hui4]
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
